Articles.Content:
That's a good idea, but any plans to make a texture set that matches your FASA/Novapunch textures??

I remember the person who makes Stretchy Tanks made a texture pack to match his new textures he's making/made(?) for the ST mod, and IIRC the makers of the KOSMOS mod made a set of fairings using Procedural Fairings that had matching textures to those used by his parts....
I don't make StretchyTanks. I just added a few fixes. AncientGammoner made ST, but he's been busy with school.

So I have wanted to do this one for a while, its a surface attachable SRB separator. I hate trying to line up sepretrons on the same side, plus this lets me just put one on per booster, or 5, what ever you like.
Wow, that looks amazingly useful! And unlike the nosecone SRB trick, you can even adjust the center of thrust for this!
Holding out on me I see.
OOooh I want it, looks useful.

So the funny bit on the new pod is that 2 of the guys are upside down, so the cameras are also upside down. Also added a floating sandwich, it floats even when not in zero G but, I like it, so it stays.

Also added foot holes to the outside of Big G helpful!

Will release it after I make sure .22 didn't break anything.
Fantastic! And the IVA, just great
Looking great, frizzank! Can't wait to fly this baby. And the floating sandwich is sweet!

Frizzank i realise it was put to a vote but can i just say it makes more sense with the parts tree to make the Atlas rocket and the Agenda before the MOL and ask you to consider doing the MOL later? or it least to put the parts necessary to make an Atlas early on in the tree
Oh, instruments! So, the Big G is going to be an actual command pod and not just a crew module? Nice.
no its just a crew compartment, but just like the others you can fly it from there if there is a command module attached. I just thought it was a little boring in there without them.
great I posted twice, Fun, guess I am going to have to fill it with something?
so like do you see the front regardless if there is a regular module there? or is there some sort of trickery going on?
No its just the same interior regardless.
OK, 0.22 is out. It doesn't seem to have broken anything important.
I can't wait to play with the Big G as soon as possible. Project Gemini is my favorite craft family!

Those interiors looks even better from those perspectives. The up-side-down Kerbals will probably make this mod a meme

FASA 2.3 is going to be the cherry on top of the new KSP update.

So while I was waiting for .22 to come out, I made some parts. Like always only because I really want them when I build rockets.

O2, and H2 separate fuel tanks, a combined tank, and a mini mono tank.

Unlike the stock rcs tank you can attach things to the outside of it!

If you attach them to a strut and the engine is on the strut you don't need fuel lines.

Also Big G added to spaceport. As always post bugs if you find them.

http://www./download/xbg8r8fz5gykhy2/FASA2.3_BigG.zip

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/gemini-and-mercury-frizzank-aeronautical-space-administration-fasa/

Just as I was finished initially toying with 0.22 and was planning to go to bed...

Thanks

EDIT: Some stuff I noticed:

  • Big G in part titles is spelled as Gig G everywhere.
  • The Big G Docking Bay is far too light. It weighs less than the Gemini Pod or the Landing Legs. From the schematics we've seen a thousand times in this thread, it seems to have quite a bit space for fuel. Probably less than the regular Equipment section of the normal Gemini configuration, but not as little as it has now. The fuel tanks aren't as long as the regular Equipment section, but it's wider which evens everything out.
  • The Big G craft file has two RCS thruster packs on the front. Not realistic, nor necessary. If you put your RCS quad in the right place on the Big G's back it handles like a dream.
  • Some few CFG tweaks need to be made to make the current parts compatible with the science gathering part of 0.22. You probably knew that, but I thought I'd let you know in case you haven't checked it out very thoroughly yet.

Overall it's a wonderful update though. The Big G docking works great, the extra crew space comes in very handy. A tip for other players: the RCS quad from KW Rocketry fits perfectly with the FASA theme/detailing and doesn't stand out like the stock RCS quad.

Edited October 17, 2013 by CaptRobau

Awesome I am horrible at proof reading, thanks for the help. Will tweak the docking port thing some more as well. When I do the MOL and Agena, they will be science specific updates. Until then if some one would like to help integrate the science gathering into the current cfg's I would be most grateful.
I am not able to dock with big G when i tried using smart A.S.S. after using both the "control from here" using the button and its off by about 90 degrees

For current science: just need to add this to the Gemini pod, lander, or any crewable space:



MODULE
{
	name = ModuleScienceExperiment	

	experimentID = crewReport

	experimentActionName = Crew Report
	resetActionName = Discard Crew Report
	reviewActionName = Review Report

	useStaging = False	
	useActionGroups = True
	hideUIwhenUnavailable = True	
	rerunnable = True

	xmitDataScalar = 1.0
}
MODULE
{
	name = ModuleScienceContainer

	reviewActionName = Review Stored Data
	storeActionName = Store Experiments
	evaOnlyStorage = True
	storageRange = 1.3
}

An atmopsheric pressure sensor might make sense for the nose section of Gemini too:


MODULE
{
	name = ModuleScienceExperiment	

	experimentID = atmosphereAnalysis

	experimentActionName = Run Atmosphere Analysis
	resetActionName = Discard Data
	reviewActionName = Review Data

	useStaging = False	
	useActionGroups = True
	hideUIwhenUnavailable = True	
	rerunnable = True

	xmitDataScalar = 0.9
}

The Gemini Nose Cone makes more sense as the place for the antenna: http://www.svengrahn.pp.se/radioind/GeminiRadios/GeminiAntennaSystems.gif

Edited October 17, 2013 by CaptRobau
could have both, actually
